5. If the child becomes unresponsive, call emergency services immediately, start CPR, and continue until help arrives.

• Conduct a thorough intake: medical history, current medications, lifestyle, eating patterns

• Design a balanced meal plan: adequate protein, fiber, micronutrients; moderate calorie deficit  
• Prescribe gradual increases in physical activity—cardio + strength training  
• Discourage extreme diets, unregulated supplements, and unsupervised fasting  
• Refer to or collaborate with physicians, dietitians, or mental‐health providers as needed  
• Schedule regular check‐ins to monitor progress, adjust the plan, and address barriers  
• Maintain empathy, nonjudgmental support, and cultural sensitivity throughout the process
